headline: Thinking Outside the Concrete-and-Brick Box
abstract: In New York City, a developer got an exemption to build rental buildings using mostly timber. Is this the climate-friendly wave of the future?
lead_paragraph: Exposed wood may be a familiar sight in some 19th-century buildings in New York City, like lofts in TriBeCa and Dumbo, where it was necessarily used in columns, joists and ceilings. But in the kinds of apartments that make up most of the cityâ€™s current housing stock, the only timber that is visible in a near-natural state is on the floor.
